intro: Sphenogyne triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed sphenogyne, is a rare and distinctive flowering plant species. It belongs to the family Sphenogyneae and is characterized by its unique tri-lobed leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forest regions. Its botanical features include a short stem, alternate leaves with three distinct lobes, and pale yellow to greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
